But Sam soon learned she wasn't the only one at the park tonight. As she took five more steps, her attraction to the night's pleasures was met with a faint wailing sound. Not the typical, cliched ghost calls, but actual crying. "Who's that?" she asked. Caught by the mysterious noise, Sam went to find its source.

To her surprise, it was a ghost wailing. She had green hair and light gray skin. She wore leggings, a black tank top and red jacket similar to those worn by bikers. Sam knew this ghost. "Kitty?" she said. Hearing the comment, the sobbing phantom titled her head toward her visitor.

"I know you. You're that chick that Danny hangs with." the green-haired ghost spoke.

"Yeah, nice to meet you too." Sam replied with her usual tone of voice.

"You're probably wondering where Johnny is." Kitty spoke as she drew another tear.

"Not really." Sam said. "Good." she said as violent as she could. "What happened with Johnny?" Sam asked with a little more concern. "He broke up with me." she said, "Because of this." She showed Sam a small layer of fat she developed.

Looking at it, Sam said, "That's it? It's barely noticeable." "Try explaining that to him." Kitty spoke with a huff. "Listen. You're pissed off at Johnny. I understand. Boys can be thick-headed." Sam said as she sat next to her. Placing her arm on her shoulder, Sam comforted her. Kitty sniffed and smiled at Sam's kind gesture.

"Thank you." Kitty said. "No problem. I'm not as dark as everyone says I am. I'm lonely tonight. What do you say we hang at...
1553321.title: Goth Meets Street.

choices: Sam and Kitty want some real food
Sam and Kitty begin to have strange feelings
15533211.content:
"Sure, I'd like that." Kitty said, happy for some companionship.

Sam and Kitty then walked (or flew, in Kitty's case) back to Sam's house. They went down to Sam's basement, where Kitty's jaw dropped. She saw a huge television, surround sound speakers, big comfy chairs, and a concession stand with popcorn, candy, and soda.

"THIS is your basement!?" Kitty said.

"Yeah, um, it is." Sam said. "I never tell people this, but my family is pretty rich."

"Really? Cool!" Kitty said. "Man, I'm surprised there isn't a bowling alley down here!"

"Actually..." Sam said, pulling a lever. The television the sunk into the floor, revealing of all things a bowling alley.

"Wow, this is awesome!" Kitty said.

"Yeah, It is." Sam said, pulling the lever back, bringing back the television. "So, what do you want to watch?"

"Well, I'd like something scary." Kitty said.

Soon, the two girls were watching a scary movie, while Kitty began to gorge herself on popcorn and candy. Sam, not wanting to make Kitty feel bad, decided that she should do the same. As the movie went on, they continued to feed.

'Mmm, this is good stuff...' Kitty thought.

'Maybe I should stop eating. But it is a good batch tonight.' Sam thought.

Just then a powerful jump-scare happened in the movie, making Kitty jump onto Sam's lap, her arms wrapped around her. Sam felt their stuffed bellie rub up against each other, and she had to admit, it felt nice having Kitty's arms around her...
15533211.title: A movie at Sam's
